website_summaries.verdict: The Jaybird X2 is an improvement over the Bluebuds X and one of the better wireless sports headphones out there -- so long as you get a snug, comfortable fit.
pros: The Jaybird X2 has been in improved in a number of small ways from its predecessor, offering better sweat-proofing, a new matte finish, a more comfortable ear fin design, a better carrying case and improved battery life
It also sounds good and offers a reliable wireless connection
cons: It may not offer a comfortable fit (and tight seal) for everyone
This new model looks the same as the old model -- the design hasn't changed -- and it's somewhat expensive

customer_reviews.title: They stopped working after 1 month of use. The ...
customer_reviews.text: They stopped working after 1 month of use. The company was willing to give me an "upgraded" version called the Freedom. However, the Freedom only has 4 hours of battery life. It's not what I wanted. They weren't willing for whatever reason, to replace this product which is all I wanted. I would be very cautious in buying from this company.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer R.

customer_reviews.title: Hard to fit small ears
customer_reviews.text: I'm really on the fence about these. I've played around a lot with the fit. They seem to work best over the ear. The sound quality is great though. I got the x2 because the controller is smaller than the x3, but I noticed the ear pieces are larger to accommodate charging. The x3 doesn't have a USB charger however, it uses a charging port instead. I'm not sure if it is worth the upgrade. My ears are very small so it is challenging to find ear buds that are comfortable. If get tired of adjusting these I may have to look into other brands.
customer_reviews.author: jessica

customer_reviews.title: First the good. Battery life is great Easy to operat Stylish ...
customer_reviews.text: After reading so many reviews, I was very excited to try these out. I primary used these for running and lifting weights at the gym. First the good. Battery life is great Easy to operat Stylish Nice case Lots of fitment options The bad Not very loud Won't stay in ears if you get sweaty ears during cardio Outer ear pieces keep the earbuds in but let ambient sound leak in Overall, I think these are over priced or should have an option for over the ear clips to hold them secure. I was really disappointed and wound up getting Klipsch R6i's. Although not wireless, they are far superior in fitment and sound quality to the Jaybirds.
customer_reviews.author: Vulture

customer_reviews.title: Customer Service Fail
customer_reviews.text: The product itself is solid. Like a host of other reviewers, I want to add my voice about their abysmal customer service and warranty. Just so you know, the "lifetime sweat proof warranty" is only good until the standard warranty ends at two years. This is when customer service deems the device is end of life. So, in the future, we will take our money to a company who actually stands behind their marketing. It's too bad because the product itself is great, as long as it never breaks. If you have $150 to buy new headphones every two years, go for it.
customer_reviews.author: Casey H.

customer_reviews.title: Lasted over 2 years of daily use
customer_reviews.text: Amazon says I purchased these May 6, 2016. That means I got 2yr and 4mo of daily use before the inline remote failed today. I treat my headphones like garbage. I crumple them up and stuff in my jeans pocket. I throw them in my backpack mixed with other misc items. I've broken more than one pair of expensive headphones in mere hours. These X2s are bulletproof. I already bought a pair of refurbished X2s to replace them. I use them everyday. Multiple hours everyday- at the gym, at the grocery store, shopping, at work. I am never without them. These are the best most reliable headphones in the world. Oh yeah, they sound good too.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Wish I had not bought them
customer_reviews.text: Everything about them looks terrible. They look cheap. They were sent to me in a cardboard box although I bought them NEW. The pieces all seem to be left overs of other sets, as many do not match. The little box it is supposed to come in is missing, even though (as silly as it might sound) it was part of the reason I wanted these. There are no instructions provided, so I'm just here wondering how they work or whatever. Would not pay 5 dollars for them now I see them...and i paid nearly 30 dollars in taxes just to get them. Worst buy ever on Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Kathya

customer_reviews.title: Terrible fit
customer_reviews.text: I don't know about the average ear-hole size, but apparently mine are too small for these. Because of that, the don't stay in place, the audio sounds weak and bass-less. I'm rating these low because of that because I consider it to be a design failure. I have had at least 20 different earbuds over the years and I've never had a fit problem like that until these. Every other brand seems to get it right.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: We'll see!
customer_reviews.text: [UPDATE] Jaybird contacted me and offered a replacement. It's nice to see a company stand by their products. Maybe my last set was a fluke: if this pair fares better I'll update this to 5 stars. Old review: My Bluebuds X, the previous model, worked amazingly well, only needed to charge every so often, and put up with all kinds of abuse. Not the X2! I've had these badboys just under a year and they're dead. Battery died, no longer hold a charge. Before total death they held less of a charge, and even at their best always ran dead sooner than my older model, despite marketing claims to the contrary. Can't recommend these, unfortunately.
customer_reviews.author: nom de plume

customer_reviews.title: Design flaws, could be much better.
customer_reviews.text: Buy from Amazon and not directly from Jaybird because the support from Amazon is much better than Jaybird. Voice does not transmit properly when used over ear. Comply foams does not have enough "memory" to allow proper insertion before it returns to its original form. Disintegrated over light usage. Rather durable, dropped it twice and stepped on it accidentally, still working fine. Good sound quality and excellent battery life. Customer service advised to use under ear and not over ear to resolve mic issue - =.= Does not pair to two devices at the same time (as advertised) Need to try all sets of provided buds and fins to find proper fit.
customer_reviews.author: You Don't Need To Know My Name

customer_reviews.title: poor, poor quality
customer_reviews.text: I am very disappointed in these. When I first received them, they worked fine. I am not a workout fanatic, which means I work out once or twice a week for around 45 minutes each session. Over the course of a year (how long I've had these) they haven't been worn very much. Tonight I tried turning them on and they didn't work. There isn't even a light or prompt when I try to charge them. I noticed the issue yesterday and left them on the charger over night. I have really lost faith in all bluetooth devices. They are spotty at best. Try another brand. Don't buy these.
customer_reviews.author: JC

customer_reviews.title: Headphones died after a year and a half
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these headphones in January 2018, and they worked great, until the last month or so. They were cutting out and losing connection, the battery would die prematurely, and sometimes they wouldn't turn on unless you plugged them into the charging cable for a second. Right now, they are completely dead. The stay on for about 2-3 minutes, and then they are off until you "charge them" for a few seconds. Completely useless for workouts or travel now. They were rock solid for over a year... then poof. Can the company do anything about this?
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Corrales

customer_reviews.title: I mean disgusting dripping droplets of sweat as he's walking away kind ...
customer_reviews.text: These are the real deal, NOT fake ones. My husband wears these at the gym, and he gets sweaty, I mean disgusting dripping droplets of sweat as he's walking away kind of sweaty. He works out hard. These are perfect for him. The sweat has not caused issues, the activity or moving around in all sorts of positions at different speeds and intensities, not an issue. We do wish they sounded just a TAD better but you can hear just fine. If you're an audiophile, however, you may find small issues with the sound. They charge fast also. No complaints worth mentioning, really. All of my few, small "complaints" are personal issues and nothing to do with the product.
customer_reviews.author: H.T.

customer_reviews.title: Not good sound, also they begin to distort on the ...
customer_reviews.text: Not good sound, also they begin to distort on the left driver, because of all the good reviews, I tought that these would really sound well, but to be honest they sound distorted in all the highs, I had the oportunity to go to a bose store, and Tryed and comapred this ones with the Bose Wireless Sound sport, and this Jaybirds sounds like a 10 dll earphones compared to the Bose, I know that these ones limits the ambient sound, and hte obse let all the ambient noise trought in, but the sound quality overpases by far this not so good, (I writed "mediocre !" but thats too hard)Hearphones.
customer_reviews.author: Quake

customer_reviews.title: gave out after 2 months
customer_reviews.text: originally bought a pair of these and got about a year and a half out of them, which is decent for me. this set, died within 2 months of use and yeah, had to move on to something else. don't know what happened with them as they did not get snagged on anything or around unusual moisture, they just up and died which is to bad as I did like the fit and feel of them.
customer_reviews.author: Maximous

customer_reviews.title: Well, they worked for a while.
customer_reviews.text: I was very optimistic about these headphones. I've had several other models stop working while running marathons due to sweat shorting them out. These headphones were supposedly sweat proof. I've only used them a handful of times, and the right ear is now completely out of balance. It's practically silent even with the headphones turned all the way up. I've tried recharging them, and using them with different devices (iphone, and two different laptops) and nothing seems to resolve the problem. I've effectively paid nearly $200 for a one ear headphone.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan M. Richter

customer_reviews.title: Good sound & Good service.
customer_reviews.text: This is a revised review. The first one I received was defective. I was contacted by Jaybird and was offered a replacement. The process is efficient and they are impressively cooperative. I finally got the new one which works perfectly, and I'm satisfied with the sound quality and features of the phones. Bluetooth connection is quick and effective. No complaint. This is additional review after more than one year of use. With foam tip that perfectly fits, the sound quality is amazing.
customer_reviews.author: Thitipong

customer_reviews.title: Only lasted a year and a half
customer_reviews.text: These were fantastic for a year and a half and then completely went downhill. The sound quality was excellent, they held a charge for a long time- I loved them. The low rating is due to the fact that I’m not even two years in and they’ve completely stopped working. I’m out of luck because I’ve past the one year warranty mark. I expected more, given the price point and the fact that I am not hard on my electronics. I’ll be rebuying headphones but probably going with a different company.
customer_reviews.author: Jess P

customer_reviews.title: Great sound but otherwise disappointing.
customer_reviews.text: Good sound, poor bluetooth connectivity, poor interface with Android, quit after 16 months. The wings come off too easily and I lost them. These sound better than my Plantronics Backbeat Fit but I can't go more than 30' without the bluetooth cutting out. I could walk all over the gym with the Backbeats. I am not sure if it is an Android issue or a Jaybird issue but I can't pause music with the inline controls. As of recently, I can fully charge these, turn them on to test, turn them off, and then go to the gym and they won't turn on. Overall, I am disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: NHansen

customer_reviews.title: Lots of Bluetooth options...pick another brand.
customer_reviews.text: This was my second set of jaybirds and I have 5 other brands too. Bought them for my wife after I liked the ones I used. As will everyone else(google search the issue), one of the ear buds stopped working. Very disappointed and of all my Bluetooth headsets, this is the only one that has failed. Only has 1 year warranty. Customer service response took days and no joy on a replacement.
customer_reviews.author: Sean

customer_reviews.title: Great Earbuds
customer_reviews.text: These are hands down my favorite earbuds right now. The battery usually lasts me ~6 hours, give or take 30 minutes if I didn't charge them enough (although they charge reasonably quickly anyway!). The sound quality is quite good, bluetooth sound will never be quite as good as 3.5mm but these still do a fine job. I'm not a fan of the comply foam ear inserts, but the standard rubber ones fit nicely in my ear and do not fall out coupled with the rubber "wings". The Jaybirds are an excellent choice for exercise earbuds, or just general use.
customer_reviews.author: Aidan McDonald

customer_reviews.title: Safety issue, do not buy.
customer_reviews.text: Earbud tips provided with the headphones get loose over time (~3-4 months). Eventually, one of the tips got stuck in my ear canal when removing the headphone. Very close to having to go to the Emergency Room to get it extracted. My wife was able to coax it out with tweezers. Contacted Jaybird support, they refuse to help. There's no ridge on the earbuds that hold the tip in place. I returned these. All that said, they sound fine. Battery life is fine, never really had them die on me charging every few days. I had connection issues with mine with an iPhone 7+, but it seems like the 7+ has poor bluetooth anyway.
customer_reviews.author: Chris W.

customer_reviews.title: Terrible fit.  Single device connectivity.
customer_reviews.text: These headphones have pretty good sound quality and good connectivity, but they DO NOT stay in your ears. They come with multiple sized earbud tips and ear-hooks and none of them seem to work for me (I have tried them all). Luckily, I do not use these to exercise (good fitting wired earbuds work fine for me)-- I only use them at work. I wish they could automatically switch the Bluetooth connection to my phone when I get a call, but apparently Jaybird chose a stronger single Bluetooth connection over automatic switching. I just wish they would stay in my ears, and I didn't have to adjust them constantly : (
customer_reviews.author: Ted James

customer_reviews.title: I find them quite comfortable - even after 13 miles
customer_reviews.text: After going through two sets of headphones and dealing with where to put the cord when I run, I decided to buy myself something before this year's final half marathon. I got them the week before my race so I have a weeks worth of training plus the half marathon on these so far. I found the over the ear directions a little puzzling so elected to wear them in the standard position. I figured if they weren't secure then I'd go back and figure it out. These fit so securely, I've had no need to go back. I find them quite comfortable - even after 13 miles. I'd definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: between these days

customer_reviews.title: Mediocre headphones at best.
customer_reviews.text: Mediocre headphones at best. The connection is decent, pairs fast and the distance from phone is relatively good. The sound quality however is acceptable at best. At high volumes the music can get distorted really quick. I have a set of Monster iSport headphones and those are much, much better than these. The battery life is also dismal, nowhere near the 8 hours they claim. I used the headphones for two days during my workouts, so a total of 3 hours used and the battery is already dead. I most likely will be returning these and try my luck with a different brand of Bluetooth headphones. Do your research before you sink your money into these headphones.
customer_reviews.author: Prab R.

customer_reviews.title: Great Sound, not the best fit for my ears. Died after 3 months.
customer_reviews.text: Ear buds seem great! Great sound! Connect easily. Only issue is that when they are hard to get securely in place. I have worn them out to run, and to work out, I'm constantly adjusting them. I've tried multiple ear bud attachments to see if I can find a better fit, but no real great results. After I finally figured out the best fit, these were great. I've worn them no more than 20 times for less than 45 minutes each time. This week they died... won't come on, when they plug in they look like they are charged. Nothing. Disappointing, but not totally uncommon based on other reviews.
customer_reviews.author: TEllison27

customer_reviews.title: These headsets sound way better than my older (but expensive) wired ones I replaced ...
customer_reviews.text: These headsets sound way better than my older (but expensive) wired ones I replaced them with. They are very comfortable and I use them at the gym and for work on the phone and battery life and sound on the phone is very good. I'm not normally one to write too many reviews but I just called jaybird bc one of the foam ear pieces had deteriorated a bit and they agreed to send me new pairs for free as a one time concession. Net net a great product and even better customer service. I don't mind paying a premium price when I get a superior product and great customer service. Bravo Jaybird!
customer_reviews.author: DomPoww

customer_reviews.title: Good performance; Ear pieces detach and get stuck in ear.
customer_reviews.text: Headphones work fine with decent battery life. However, after a few months of daily use, the ear pieces are detachable and keep getting stuck in my ear. Battery: Good. Longest battery you'll find in this form factor Customer Service: Poor. Headphones came missing a piece. Took customer service over a week to reply to my email, and they said I'd have to return the whole package and re-order, or buy a replacement piece. Design: Average. Inline remote buttons do not not match the standard iOS convention, and I've found it nearly impossible to learn them. Ear pieces get stuck in your ear... which can be a little scary.
customer_reviews.author: Richard

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed after hopes were high.
customer_reviews.text: At first the headphones worked as advertised. But after about a month I started having issues with them loosing connection. It progressively has gotten worse to the pount now where they will not stay connected even fully charged for more than about 5 mins. I will never buy a Jay bird product again.
customer_reviews.author: Nathan & Lauren Davis

customer_reviews.title: Died within 16 Months
customer_reviews.text: Headphones worked fine for the first year, but then started to fade in and out, and then ultimately stopped working completely. After sixteen months they were completely dead. I contacted the company's warranty department two seprate times by email, but they never bothered to respond. I am not happy with the product and the company's customer service is terrible.
customer_reviews.author: Elyse

customer_reviews.title: My new best friends.
customer_reviews.text: I've owned a massive amount of earbuds and headphones, and these are the ones I now take with me wherever I go. I walk around the city a lot and whenever these aren't in my pocket I get frustrated. They are easy to travel with, can take a beating, and last a long time. The difference between 4,5, or 6 hours and 8 is big when it comes to real world usage. I can take these out with me 4 or 5 times before having to plug in. The Plantronics that I returned were constantly dieing on me. These are worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: sideswiper

customer_reviews.title: Okay Ear Buds
customer_reviews.text: The ear buds are nice. They appear very sturdy, and sound quality is okay. I bought this ear for running the only thing is that they don't stay i your ear for long. I used every ear attachment to no avail. Once again these are well made buds but I only use them now for watching TV and they still fall out my ears.
customer_reviews.author: Yougo

customer_reviews.title: Best workout earbuds I've used
customer_reviews.text: These Jaybird X2s hit the mark as far as sound & build quality is concerned. They've been my workout companions ever since my wireless Jaylab Epics died on me & I decided to switch it up with the X2s especially after I heard about the improved battery life. The only thing that I'm still getting used to is the fit with the wingy things that are supposed help with a snug, secure fit & guarantee the buds won't fall out of your ears while you are on the move. I was used to the over-ear memory wire fit on my wireless Jlab Epics. Other than that, these are a must have!
customer_reviews.author: Mangi

customer_reviews.title: Tough to fit, but worth the effort
customer_reviews.text: There are very near a 5 star. I would go 4.5 if that was possible. As many will talk about on their review, the fitting process takes some effort. I use the comfort foam buds, and one ear fits like a dream. My other ear however I still don't have perfect. I probably would not notice if the other ear did not fit so well. All that said, the buds sound great, connect right away and last as advertised. I have so many devices that I need to keep charge, it is refreshing that these easily last for several work outs/listening sessions. The carrying box is nice as well, closing securely and opening easily.
customer_reviews.author: Walt Danker

customer_reviews.title: Terribly sounding and the worst fit ever. Don't understand why people like it.
customer_reviews.text: I hate the sound, besides, it kept falling off my ear no matter what I did. Maybe if you are a big guy with big ears they might fit. I am an audio engineer and I love headphones, I have lots of different headphones each for an especial occasion so I am used to good ones, and ok ones. This one didn't even sound better than the one that Apple gives us with the iPhone. I don't really understand why so manny people like it, I had been wanting to buy these for a while to work out, and I felt bad for disliking it so much. I am much better off with Skullcandy, believe it or not.
customer_reviews.author: Katia Jabour Dotto

customer_reviews.title: Price/Benefit Ratio is Top-Notch
customer_reviews.text: After a lot of research and YouTube reviews, I found these were rated among the best across the board. They sound fantastic, plenty of highs/mids/lows help whatever I'm listening to sound wonderful (typically, I listen to hip-hop, alternative and classic rock, and dubstep). My only gripe is that sometimes when I'm at the gym, the range/connection with my phone seems to be spotty. Not sure if that's because everyone else there is doing the same thing. Happens significantly less now, though. Can't recommend these headphones enough!
customer_reviews.author: Elmer C. Moore Jr.

customer_reviews.title: I really wanted to like these
customer_reviews.text: I currently have a pair of Bose wired headphones which are extremely comfortable but I'm really tired of dealing with the wire. Received these and immediately charged them and started trying out the tips and wings. I couldn't find a combination of tips/wings to make these comfortable. I've discovered, through this process, that I can't handle having something 'seal' the ear canal like all these tips do. When I wore these I could hear myself swallow, I could hear myself walking, I could hear my jacket collar rub against the cord across my neck. This type of headphone just isn't going to work for me. Thankful for Amazon allowing me to return these.
customer_reviews.author: MTGirl69

customer_reviews.title: Would not stay in my ears
customer_reviews.text: The sound on this Jaybird model is pretty good for ear buds. However, I just could not get them to stay in my ears. I tried every one of the various ear adapters that came with the buds, but none of them worked even remotely well. I have owned other wireless earbuds and while some of them also did not do a great job of staying in my ears, none of them were anywhere near as bad as these. Even the most modest amount of moving around and the buds would fall out. Many other reviewers have apparently not had this problem, but I sure did. For me, they were useless.
customer_reviews.author: Fred K, Sacramento

customer_reviews.title: X2's faulty
customer_reviews.text: I bought these on prime day because they were such a good deal. I didn't need them yet as my 3 year old bluebuds were still going strong. Last month they finally started to act up so I opened up my new X2's. One month later, they're already malfunctioning to the point that they are worthless. They cycle on and off constantly until the battery dies. They've never gotten wet or abused. I've got an email in to jaybird. Hoping their customer service will be responsive. I will update this review if they stand by their products....
customer_reviews.author: Sidney S.

customer_reviews.title: Used or not authentic product
customer_reviews.text: I received this order today and opened the mail box immediately but was very disappointed. The Jaybird package was obviously opened before it arrived. The seal stickers were all peeled and were stuck randomly to the plastic surface of the inner box. The earphone was supposed to be neatly placed surrounding the black travel box but it was not. It was placed inside the black travel box in a very messy way. The ear wings are black, not neon yellow. One pair of ear tips is also missing from the ear tip box.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great headphones for the gym
customer_reviews.text: These headphones lasted me over a year before they broke. They were my first gym headphones that were bluetooth and boy was that a game changer. Not having to deal with headphones in the gym was liberating. They were comfy, never fell out of my ears, and sound quality was 100. They got extremely sweaty and still worked for months. 10/10 recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan DeLesDernier

customer_reviews.title: Second pair worked great
customer_reviews.text: The first set I received did not work correctly (the power on/off stopped responding). The replacement set works great. Connects quickly, great sound, long battery for my purposes. They stay in my ears! (So many other brands do not stay!) Loves that it comes with all the size options.
customer_reviews.author: Tazz3L

customer_reviews.title: Sooo comfortable and don't move in ear while exercising
customer_reviews.text: Really like these headphones. It took me a few weeks of trying different sizes of foam inserts to finally get fitting right. Once I did these things are great. Long battery life. Sound quality is really good. Most of all they are comfortable. I wear them so the wire is behind my head and I forget they are there. The little wings are genius and really and truly keep them in your ears. These are the first ear buds I've owned that don't shift, move ,or need constant readjusting.
customer_reviews.author: E Nabhan

customer_reviews.title: This is a tough review because I don't love giving negative reviews so I'll explain why only two ...
customer_reviews.text: This is a tough review because I don't love giving negative reviews so I'll explain why only two stars. Pros: 1-I love the sound quality! 2-I love that I can go upstairs and leave my phone downstairs and I still can hear my music loud and clear without bad reception. 3-The phone pairs SO nicely 4-battery lasts 8+ hours Cons: 1-It's expensive and only lasted me 6 months 2-I've given it 3 tries. That means I've spent over $100 a couple of times and each time it's died early. It was warrentied once. When it works it's great. Herein lies the problem. My third and final pair died last week. I'm done.
customer_reviews.author: Abro

customer_reviews.title: Worst $120 ever spent...
customer_reviews.text: Sound is decent, but crackly sounding. Also sound cuts in and out while working out. Headphones are NOT SWEATPROOF! I'm going on my third pair, but at this point just don't care to waste time shipping and talking with customer service just to get another garbage product sent to me. UTTER GARBAGE people! First set stopped working at about 3 months which was about 20 jogs. New set stopped after 2 to 3 short jogs, barely broke a sweat too. On top of that, the best earned option for me was the memory foam ones which fell apart after about 10 workouts. So disappointed with this purchase. Wish I went with the $20 cheapos that my buddies recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Crocker

customer_reviews.title: Nice sounding headphones with a lousy ear tip design.
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Decent bluetooth range. Good battery life. Comfortable. Flat cable. (Tangle free) Nice sound. (Not too flat. Not too much bass.) Good assortment of accessories. Cons: Packaging is overdone. (How about saving us a couple of bucks with simpler packaging.) Size range for foam ear tips differ from silicon tips. (I use the large size silicon tip. The equivalent large size foam tip is too small .) Ear tip design. (When the ear tip gets sweaty and oily, it slides off the headphone too easily. I had a headphone come off the ear tip while the ear tip was still in my ear.)
customer_reviews.author: RKO

customer_reviews.title: Jaybird lies about how long the headphones last
customer_reviews.text: I upgraded to these headphones from my old Jaybird Bluetooth headphones that would typically make it near the 2 hour mark before dying. Those headphones, like these, claim to make it to the 8 hour mark. The big answer to the question of if these do? No. At a full charge they didn't even make it to the 6 hour mark before dying. My belief is after I use them for a while they probably will only last to that 2 hour mark like my last pair. The charging cord for the last pair of headphones was also ridiculously small. I hoped they corrected that but it's just as small again. I'd recommend finding a different pair of Bluetooth headphones.
customer_reviews.author: LT

customer_reviews.title: Worth it for the freedom
customer_reviews.text: I love these ear buds. The sound is good, not quite as good as my earbuds that came with my iPhone but the fact that I don't have any wires attached to my phone is with it. They paired up so my phone easily and the functions work good. I sue them when I am weight lifting and haven't had any issues . I some times set my phone down and walk around the gym a bit while I catch my breath and haven't had any problems with the sound dropping.
customer_reviews.author: Darrick Procunier

customer_reviews.title: Overhyped and overpriced
customer_reviews.text: Not bad but definitely overhyped and overpriced. I can't use them anymore because the sound keeps cutting off whenever I'm in the street or in a busy area. They work fine if I'm in the car or sitting still which is ironic considering how they market it as a "Sport" earbuds. I'm guessing it has something to do with interferance but I can't say for sure. All I know is it's become useless now and I'm gonna buy a wired IEM. Also, everyone seems to love those "Comply" tips but I HATE them. They are coarse and unconformable and worst of all have TERRIBLE seal which is a big deal for me.
customer_reviews.author: John Smith

customer_reviews.title: The best for working out
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this headset to replace the wired headset I work out in. The ones I replaced were in ear beats, the sound on these is better I think. Bass reproduction is not as emphasized, but is just as deep and more authentic. I have had no problem with them staying in my ears, whether I am lifting, running, or doing cardio. They have enough size tips to make sure they are comfortable and last longer than 8 hours on a charge. I paid full price and DID NOT receive a discount
customer_reviews.author: Joe 827

customer_reviews.title: I really like these headphones -- the audio quality
customer_reviews.text: I really like these headphones -- the audio quality, the battery charging hold, the fit, lightweight. I use these all the time in fitness. But, I have to give it three stars because it's the second time these things have gone out on me. There's a known problem that if you charge them more than 2.5 hours, then you run a big risk of killing these. I try hard to remember not to over charge these, but at the end of the day, it's just poor engineering design. I know because I'm an electrical engineer.
customer_reviews.author: Russ Pond

customer_reviews.title: Same as the bluebuds x with a couple minor fixes
customer_reviews.text: i finally upgraded to the x2 after using the bluebuds x for a while and they are almost the same with a few fixed imperfections that the bluebuds x had. Over all i think the x2 are still great just like the bluebuds but the sound has alot more bass to it and is not as clear as the bluebuds so i preferred the bluebuds but that is just my preference in sound, Everything else from the battery to the confort is still the best. I dont think it was worth the upgrade but i still use this headphones everyday and the range is still great. BTW the headphones do not come with the clip shown in my picture.
customer_reviews.author: Alex. G

customer_reviews.title: Broke twice in 2.5 years. "Lifetime" warranty is a lie.
customer_reviews.text: In spite of the Lifetime sweat warranty listed in the description, they only honor a 1 year warranty from the date of purchase. Since the X2 is "no longer being manufactured", they consider the "lifetime" of the product to be over and therefore do not honor anything after 1 year of purchase. They begrudgingly replaced mine once after it broke 1.5 years after I purchased it, but won't honor any warranty beyond that. Avoid this product. I've heard Beats have some good workout earbuds, and everyone seems to love Airpods. Try those.
customer_reviews.author: Vivienne Steinbock

customer_reviews.title: These workout headphones are the best I've ever had
customer_reviews.text: These workout headphones are the best I've ever had. They come with multiple size attachments for all ear sizes. Also, they hold a charge for quite a while. I usually charge them every other day but they handle playing music for my longest runs (2 hours). They also connect really well with my Samsung S7 via bluetooth and have a pretty solid range! I've been almost 30 meters from my phone before the music starts to skip. I'm very pleased with this purchase as I've bought and used several different bluetooth headphones for working out and the rest have not even close to measured up. JAYBIRDS!!! Totally recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen snee

customer_reviews.title: Worked less than a year.
customer_reviews.text: Have had these for just about a year and they completely died. Started by stopping on and off at the gym. One day worked. Next day nothing. Yes they were fully charged. Finally got totally pissed and threw them out. Also after having them for only a month, they would not automatically connect to my Bluetooth. I had to forget the device and then connect.
customer_reviews.author: Rosetta

customer_reviews.title: I live with these things!
customer_reviews.text: I've used these several hours per day for most of the last year. They've been soaked in rain and sweat a hundred times. They've survived months on a job site. They sound good, the Bluetooth connectivity is probably as good as I can expect. I've had to buy a package of replacement ear cushions but if you saw how I treated this thing you'd understand. It would be nice to have an audible indicator of charge status, otherwise they are fantastic.
customer_reviews.author: Ray Crampton

customer_reviews.title: These don't fit my ears very well
customer_reviews.text: These work fine at the gym. Pairing with my iPhone works fine. I don't try to use these to hold a phone conversation. The ear buds are supposed to fit snugly into the ear. I find these to be a little too large to fit comfortably in my ear, even with the smallest foam inserts. They work, but I find that they want to fall out easily. The rubber tabs are somewhat useless. They don't really seem to do much. The sound quality seems to lack depth and bass. My Klipsh wired earbuds sound much better and fit much better into my ears. I have higher expectations on fit and sound quality for the price that I paid.
customer_reviews.author: A normal person

customer_reviews.title: Had them less than a year and they are performing poorly!
customer_reviews.text: Was a great headphone at first but....with normal use this product has become nearly unreliable in less than a year. For months now they have been cutting out when connect to different devices with actions as simple as turning my head. I have a coworker who is beginning to have the same problems with her X3's that are brand new. This just poor quality on the part of Jaybird and Logitech for headphones that are advertised to be sport and physical use. I have another pair of Bluetooth headphones that work fine and do not behave the same way as these. I will DEFINITLY be replacing these headphones and staying away from anymore Jaybirds I would not recommend this product
customer_reviews.author: Justin Webb

customer_reviews.title: Buttons stop working
customer_reviews.text: I was starting to love this headphone until the buttons stop functioning. I was able to power it on and was happily listening to my music until I noticed that I could not turn it off. I held the button to power it off for varying length of time but nothing worked. I tried to increase or decrease the volume to no avail. I searched the internet for possible solutions but nothing worked. This is especially sad as I have had the headphone in my possession for less that one week. Very sad.
customer_reviews.author: NorthernVA

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: Small package easy to travel with, durable, stay in ears. PLEASE DO NOT PLAY MUSIC LOUD AND/OR FOR EXTENDED PERIODS OF TIME!! if you do, your are damaging your hearing permenantly and you don't know it! overall, no complaint about the product, just do not over use headphone devices in general.
customer_reviews.author: Omar Shaheen

customer_reviews.title: Solid Choice On Sale
customer_reviews.text: Well worth the promotional price of $80. The sound is comparable to a decent wired earbud. The packaging is smart with included case and several types of earbuds and earpieces to make the perfect fit. It includes a USB cable to charge only at a pc, which is slightly inconvenient when you'd like a wall charger. The battery seems to last about a day and a half of heavy usage of calls and music. There is a pleasant voice response that lets you know the connection status and other small pieces of useful info. I had no issue using them with various android and iOS devices. Retail might be high, but in sale I'm well satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Earbuds sound good, but the foam covered ear piece is horrible
customer_reviews.text: Earbuds sound good, but the foam covered ear piece is horrible. The foam covered ear piece came apart within the first 2 weeks of wearing them. I contacted customer support via email and they responded with an accessory site to replace them and mentioned to remove them very carefully or they will tear. Wish I would have known that before I purchased them. They do offer a solid ear piece cover, but that one doesn't fit comfortable in my ear. The foam ones are designed to be a custom fit, which they were, until they fell apart. I would have returned these for a refund, but I missed my return window because of my business travel.
customer_reviews.author: O BTW

customer_reviews.title: Takes a while to find the right fit
customer_reviews.text: These headphones have been reliable so far with good sound. It did take me about a week of using it until I could figure out which ear tips and wings fit my ear best. I typically use it over the ear for working out and running. I will occasionally play some basketball with it and it stays pretty well secure. I had some earlier issues with people being able to hear my voice over bluetooth but that may have been related to my phone. No problems in the last few weeks although my voice is usually quieter to people, which seems to have been my typical experience with bluetooth earbuds
customer_reviews.author: Andy

customer_reviews.title: Consult the Warranty Prior to Purchase!
customer_reviews.text: I am updating my previous 5 start rating to a one star rating. I have used this product since 2/2016. I absolutely love them, however the wire that connects them has started to fray - the casing is wearing off - after just about a year and a half's use. I consulted the warranty and this is not covered. I am truly disappointed that the company doesn't stand behind their product beyond one year. I paid $131.00 for this product, I expected them to stand behind their product.
customer_reviews.author: Jean Homer

customer_reviews.title: Watch out for bootleg version - Real ones are awesome!
customer_reviews.text: So, finally, on my 3rd try, I received a good pair. The first pair I received, through an Amazon-fulfilled supplier were definitely counterfeit as described in previous reviews. One of the reviews gives you some features to look for. The main thing for me were those in a white box were legit, gray, not legit. They also sounded totally different and much better. The second pair I received directly from Amazon were sold as new but I received an open-box and they had ear wax on them, very nasty. The last pair were directly from Amazon and new in box and everything was great. Bass was good, but not overwhelming and sound quality was excellent.
customer_reviews.author: Jim J.

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good sound and decent for the treadmill
customer_reviews.text: The sound is really pretty good. I'm a bass player, and I can hear the bass parts in songs really well through these. The foam earpieces are decent for running. They work a little better on a treadmill than running outside. The randomness introduced by running outside seems to work the earpieces loose more readily. I did find that switching to the isolation ear pieces available for these (separate purchase) makes them pretty decent for running outdoors, even on trails.
customer_reviews.author: Timothy Byrne

customer_reviews.title: Not worth it...and manufacturer does not respond...
customer_reviews.text: Bought (2) sets- one for me, one for my wife. Only getting about 3-4 hours from a full charge. (Not 8 hours as marketed).Bluetooth range is limited- i often have to switch pockets to prevent signal issues. I guess the manufacturer expects you to be able to have your phone no further that 2 feet away? Not impressed- and was expecting more performance for the price. Sound is good, build is good- but they need to accurately market the device. Direct emails to the manufacturer went unanswered. Avoid. Update 1/2017. Headset now disconnects randomly. Contacting Manufacturer for a return authorization. Cannot stress enough- AVOID- buy something cheaper- as this is not worth any sort of premium.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Customer service is a joke.
customer_reviews.text: Garbage. Planned obsolescence. Breaks a couple of months before warranty limit. These guys spend more on packaging than the actual product. Worst part is customer service is non existent - its a blackhole of no response and not even an acknowledgement that you reported an issue. Spend your money on cheap ones. I could’ve bought 5 for the price of this so-called premium product.
customer_reviews.author: Lambo

customer_reviews.title: Too large, uncomfortable, and annoying.
customer_reviews.text: I spent countless hours reading online reviews before deciding on these earbuds... unfortunately my research was all for naught. These earbuds are much too large for my ears, even with the smallest silicone tips. The smallest size of sport clips also do not fit, and therefore the earbuds IMMEDIATELY start sliding out of my ears. They're extremely uncomfortable, and even more annoying. Trying to run with them was next to impossible. Compared to other earbuds I've owned in the past, these are much larger and awkwardly stick out of your ear. Will be returning soon.
customer_reviews.author: Erin B

customer_reviews.title: Best Bluetooth Earbuds!
customer_reviews.text: I am writing this as someone who previously owned the Jaybrd X1. I just recently upgraded because after a year and a half of heavy use, a piece that hold the ear piece together broke. They are easily fixable with some glue and I do intend to do that so I have a backup. There are some noticeable differences between the X1 and X2. The X2 feel lighter and almost hollow. Also, previously when you pressed the buttons on the remote, you felt an actual click. The X2 buttons are quiet and smooth. The battery, sound and range are once again excellent. Big fan!!!
customer_reviews.author: Gatsby

customer_reviews.title: Overhyped and Overpriced
customer_reviews.text: I have to say they this product is a bit overhyped and overpriced for the construction quality, sound quality, and connectivity. First of all if you like bass do not buy this. If you like loud volume do not buy this. I bought the plantronics backbeat fit and the overall quality to price ratio was twice the value, only negative thing about the plantronic is the sound leak. I'd end up returning my x2 because the connection was poor and quality was meh for a $150+ headset.
customer_reviews.author: Thinh Dinh

customer_reviews.title: Poor Quality - Stop working within 6 months.
customer_reviews.text: I'm very disappointed with Jaybird. I've purchased both the Original and X2, and they both stopped working within about 6 months (it would not turn on). Keep in mind that I use it primarily for running. It promised to be sweat proof but it is not. I reached out to their Support group and they were no help (no response). Why buy expensive headphones that are of such low quality. I'll start buy cheap $30 throw away buds that are almost as good and I wouldn't care as much if they die in 6 months. PS: If you plan to use it for causal listening, it maybe fine for you.
customer_reviews.author: N. Son

customer_reviews.title: Stay Away From this Product.
customer_reviews.text: Stay Away From this Product. I am on my second pair; both have hardware issues and stopped working after 8 -10 months. A few coworkers who have the same have experienced similar issues and similar issues with customer support. One buddy is on his 3rd pair!!! When I contacted Jaybird I was told they would not honor the warrantee because I didn't have a receipt for the first set of headphones. (It was given as a gift.) I am moving on to Dre Beats... If I am going to put this much money behind a product I want it to work and I want the support if it doesn't.
customer_reviews.author: ss

customer_reviews.title: Not impressed
customer_reviews.text: After seeing these things for a while and wishing I had a pair, once I got them I wasn't impressed for a few reasons: 1. While I liked how the flexible but ridged "wings" locked the ear piece into the ear nicely, I could not find a suitable fitting ear piece that wasn't to big or to small. They either hurt while they were in or the fit would only last until you started sweating. 2. Once in use they would stay on. Something was triggering them to stop my music. I couldn't figure out what. Once I switch to another pair of Bluetooth headphone, no issues. So it has to be them.
customer_reviews.author: dlemmonhead

customer_reviews.title: Expensive but worth it
customer_reviews.text: Great sound, the best available in Bluetooth, and range is also excellent. I used the 'over-ear' fit so I could reduce the cord while working out. Takes a while and a fair amount of tweaking to get the 'over-ear' fit right, but when it's right, you know it from the fit and the sound. Putting them on seems tricky at first but soon becomes second nature. I used a mirror at first, now I don't need to. I love them and would buy them again in a heartbeat.
customer_reviews.author: Frank S.

customer_reviews.title: Great sound quality for bluetooth!
customer_reviews.text: Use this while running with my Droid Turbo 2 Android phone. Works excellent while running. The sound quality is very good for a BT earbud. The fit, once you settle on the ear piece you like, is snug and secure. It connects fast and has not lost signal one time with my phone. I have yet to run into an issue where the battery is going to end, but I do keep it plugged in after every run. Case is excellent when I am traveling, it is secure in my luggage and I do not need to worry about it getting damaged!
customer_reviews.author: divisionbell

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy Jaybird X2 Bluetooth Ear buds
customer_reviews.text: This is my second pair of Jaybird X2 bluetooth ear buds. they sound great but while going through all the texting back and forth on warranty of the first pair I bought a second pair, first pair lasted 4 1/2 months which they finally replaced and the second pair lasted only 3 1/2 weeks the problem is in the controls on the cable to control volume and on and off. I would not buy these again I have since purchased a pair of Monster HD clarity bluetooth ear buds which seem a lot more dependable. I have only used all these at the gym only they are not abused.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Gonzales

customer_reviews.title: I love these headphones
customer_reviews.text: I love these headphones. Not only do they sound amazing, they have great bluetooth range, and they really don't fall out of your ears. They provide you with so many options on how to set up the ear piece so that you can customize them to fit your ears perfectly. Battery life is exceptional. I was skeptical at first because there are so many other bluetooth headphones out there at various price points, but out of all that I have owned, these are the best. they work, and even when I'm working hard, they stay put.
customer_reviews.author: Jordan

customer_reviews.title: I can't hear you!
customer_reviews.text: why? because these headphones are great! the instructions suck but they give you their website with videos. It comes with 3 sizes of earbuds PLUS another 3 sets for sports. Clips to keep the string short but i don't even use them because i can't feel it. Sound is great and i can't hear the noise around me. great buy
customer_reviews.author: Paul Bessette

customer_reviews.title: Great sound and quality, worth every penny!
customer_reviews.text: I've had these for approximately 2 weeks now. I use them daily at the gym. Great fit in the ear, they supply you with different size and style ear pieces to ensure proper fit. Sound is GREAT, really much better than I expected and MUCH better than the cheapo's you buy at the gas station, Walmart, etc.. These are wireless (connect via bluetooth) and distance is great. I've not tested to see how far I could move away from my phone before losing connection, but I have been at least 15 feet away with NO signal interference or loss. I highly recommend these for those looking to get away from the dangling wires while working out.
customer_reviews.author: Dilya & Mike

customer_reviews.title: Great sound! Water resistance could use some work
customer_reviews.text: Great sound! Water resistance could use some work. Back when I had these, I was extra thiccccc so I would sweat like a hog and went through about 3 pairs of these. Good news is that customer support was quick and effective. Bad news is they will try to ship you off inferior headphones now (Freedoms) which blow compared to these. if you're not a walking sweat faucet, these are great. I've since upgraded to the X3's which have done great against sweat (I'm only thicc now so maybe that helps)
customer_reviews.author: anon

customer_reviews.title: Great earbuds, definitely reccomended
customer_reviews.text: TL,Dr: work great, very little cons, overall very good earbuds these are some very good earbuds. I bought mine from the amazon warehouse used for about $70, and I would say that they are definitely worth the money. I've never had an issue with Bluetooth (unless you count through multiple walls), no disconnection, and switching devices for input is a breeze. nearly everything about these are good, although the audio itself is just decent. from my experience the battery lasts 6-8 hours of use pros: lightweight, Bluetooth works flawlessly cons: Foam tips get flimsy and can rip after a month or so like i said before, overall these are very solid
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Can't recommend
customer_reviews.text: Bought these a couple months ago to use in the gym. Integrity wise they have held up and the wireless range is good. The sound quality is okay but its downhill after that. I've tried all combinations of tips and ear wings and the headphones will not stay in. When they aren't sitting securely in your ear, the sound quality obviously goes down. I have "normal" sized ears just for the record. They also get somewhat uncomfortable rather quickly compared to other headphones. Battery life is around 6-8 hours. I've gone back to using my Hammerhead Pros by Razer and putting up with getting the cord caught on workout equipment occasionally.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Morris

customer_reviews.title: Decent
customer_reviews.text: Over the top packaging. Luckily they have a 2 1/2 minute video on how to unpack the product from the box on their web site. Looks really nice. I just started using them and must say that I'm not that impressed with the sound quality. I think its the way they fit in my ear so I'm still working on getting a good fit. Also, my first use I did not get 8 hours as it claims. I got around 5.
customer_reviews.author: HPIII

customer_reviews.title: good headphones do not last more than 24 months
customer_reviews.text: I had 3 headphones, the first one only lasted 3 months, I returned and got my money back. I bought another one that broke within warranty and I got a replacement from Jaybird, I must say, excellent customer service, the replacement lasted approximately 24 months
customer_reviews.author: fis

customer_reviews.title: Great Upgrade from BlueBuds X
customer_reviews.text: I own the previous version of these as well (BlueBuds X), and were VERY happy with them... If you are wondering if these are better, YES THEY ARE.. I am VERY happy with these... for a few reasons 1..YES, my music sounds better..but, do not expect to be blown away vs your BlueBuds X because, they also sounded very good...but, you 'will' notice the difference.. 2...The earbuds DO fit better, especially if you are running hard, and you tend to sweat... 3.The battery seems to last longer as well... 4..I LOVE the new colors... Overall, I am VERY happy with the X2's... Well worth the money
customer_reviews.author: LA

customer_reviews.title: Great upgrade from LG HBS-730 to workout with
customer_reviews.text: Takes some getting used to. Everyone raves about the foam tips but the rubber tips work better (for me) to stay far enough in so I can really hear the bass. Had the LG Tone HBS-730s before so I wanted that same sound. LG's were awesome and slightly better because they get much louder BUT for the versatility when working out, they can't beat these. I find that I don't keep these on as much as the LG's though so I rarely use for calls anymore. Once I got the right earbuds to keep them set, they sound great.
customer_reviews.author: drouse

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Earbuds
customer_reviews.text: Love my Jaybird X2's, Sound quality is great, they stay in place and hold up to my sweet. My only problem is I wish they were just a tad louder and the battery doesn't last as long as stated. But by far the best Earbuds I have used in the gym. Jaybirds Customer for life. Would definitely buy again and again. So glad I bought these over the Power Beats plus the have a fantastic warranty. Just make sure you buy them from amazon. It will say sold and shipped buy amazon. That way you make sure you are getting genuine and that the warranty is valid.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremiah Stevens

customer_reviews.title: Great fit, very poor sound quality
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic packaging, very comfortable to wear. Tons of fitting options. I really wanted to love these headphones. However, the sound is subpar, very tiny, lacks base. It can't even remotely be compared to a fantastic sound I that am getting from Klipsh R6, another bluetooth headphones I bought. I thought that I can adjust the sound using the Jaybird iPhone app, but it doesn't support X2 (only supports Jaybird Freedom). The support from Jaybird was totally useless, and you have to google to discover that X2 could not be adjusted through equalizer on my mobile app. At the end, I returned them, grudgingly, solely because the audio quality was totally unsatisfactory.
customer_reviews.author: Edgar Kraychik

customer_reviews.title: Great product and really great sound
customer_reviews.text: Great product and really great sound. I have absolutely no issues with its operability for music and/or call making. My only issue is with the earpieces. The foam pieces provide the best non-slip fit while working out. The only issue is my ears started to get a little sore. I eventually got used to them but then they started to fall apart. The silicone are great for ears that don't sweat. If you sweat a lot in or around your years, they will start slipping out. Not enough to fall out BUT enough to lesson the sound quality you were probably enjoying. I still like them and still use them after almost a year of use.
customer_reviews.author: David S.

customer_reviews.title: I really like these. They are my first step up for ...
customer_reviews.text: I really like these. They are my first step up for BT headphones that cost $50 or so. They sound fine. I use them when walking, running so music fidelity is compromised in general having nothing to do with the headphones. But I give 5 stars because the call quality is excellent. I like to make calls on my walks and the mic picks up my voice well. They have excellent battery life as well. They come with 2 sets of three sizes or ear plug tips. I'm a big guy but use the smallest of the tips and it's still a bit too big for me
customer_reviews.author: Jerry L. Harrington

customer_reviews.title: I use them when I exercise on my road bike and they do a good job of eliminating road noise and other distracting sounds
customer_reviews.text: These headphones are quite durable and last quite a long time. I use them when I exercise on my road bike and they do a good job of eliminating road noise and other distracting sounds. The seal is good enough to block out normal noises but not so good that a honking horn can't be heard. They also come with foam inserts for exercise if you want to have more awareness of ambient sound (or if your ears sweat and you want them to "breathe"). Overall I'm happy with them and have no complaints!
customer_reviews.author: C. Gentry

customer_reviews.title: Pricey but sound good
customer_reviews.text: Wasn't highly impressed for the price I paid for them. Still, they sound better than some cheaper ones that I had previously, and I'm hoping they will last through my sweaty workouts. They are comfortable and come with several buds and wings to find the right fit. They seemed to stay on while running. Easy to pair and battery life is impressive. I'll keep them anticipating that they will last me awhile...at least that's my hope for the price I paid for them.
customer_reviews.author: Monica M.

customer_reviews.title: Great gadget
customer_reviews.text: A friend that is an avid workout nut, and athlete recommended these to me. I do all kinds of handy type work where I am covered in sweat, and my headphones always would get pulled on, or in the way. These are awesome so far. So many options of how to fit into your ear for comfort, paired on second try, has not skipped, popped, or whatever. Phone calls are awesome. I will try to report back after more time and more punishment. But my friends are a year and half old and going strong.
customer_reviews.author: Average dad

customer_reviews.title: I'm very disappointed given the high price
customer_reviews.text: I ordered my Jaybird X2 in Mar, 2016, however it didn't work from yesterday. the pause, forward, back, power buttons on headphone doesn't response. I even can't power off the headphone, I doubt if I used up the power, I even can't power on the headphone. I'm in China, I called their service center for help, they give me another phone number of local Logitech service center. I called the local Logitech service center, they said the Headphone warranty is only 1 year, my headphone is out of warranty, they can't repair. I'm very disappointed given the high price.
customer_reviews.author: flyalton

customer_reviews.title: Good while they lasted (shorter life than prior model)
customer_reviews.text: Prior pair (older model) lasted a little over 2.5 years - these lasted about 22 months being used about 4-5x per week. Really disappointing given the premium price. Very surprising also that the price has not dropped at all over that time. I'm going with knockoff EarPods this go-round, at half the price. Will report separately.
customer_reviews.author: Amy A

customer_reviews.title: NOT A FAN
customer_reviews.text: Tried to like these but struggled from the beginning...they seemed to turn themselves on in my gym bag...always dead or dying at gym time....figured it was my fault but I never had the problem with my wireless Beats....today they just died during a 5 mile run. Just shut off for no apparent reason. They were on the charger with a green light just minutes before I walked out the door....This time they are dead, will not charge and no lights...been using these for less than 6 months. No more Jaybirds for me.....I am not a fan and will tell my friends to avoid.
customer_reviews.author: Bake5910

customer_reviews.title: Blah.
customer_reviews.text: These really are mediocre. As a runner, these don't stay in my ear very well. I have tried all the different ear tips that come with the product and they all eventually fall out while running. The sound quality isn't anything special either and they aren't nearly loud enough. I would not buy these again and would no recommend to anyone. Update: Still not pleased, I have moved onto other headphones. Update 2: A few months in, basically, if you are a runner and you sweat a lot. Do not buy these.
customer_reviews.author: GG

customer_reviews.title: Great for weight lifting
customer_reviews.text: The sound quality is amazing. It easily connects with my phone. It does take a second to turn on/off, though. I've not had a problem with it slipping out of my ear, and I've run and jumped rope in it. Mostly, I weight lift at the gym; I still get super sweaty, though. I have the blue color and it's much easier than the black headphones to see the red light when the headphones turn off and the green light when its on. I would give it five stars if the volume buttons consistently worked and if the blue tips didn't fall off.
customer_reviews.author: Aiylan

customer_reviews.title: Almost perfect
customer_reviews.text: Great headphones. Sound quality is awesome for listening to music. They work great in the gym too. Battery life is way better than expected. I use them on average two hours a day and I get almost a full week on a single charge. Cons: - To turn them off, you have to hold the button way too long - Sound quality for phone calls is quite average - Ear tips start sliding off easily after a while. They sometimes stay in my ear or just slip off until I lost one today.
customer_reviews.author: Mladen Bajic

customer_reviews.title: an excellent bluetooth headphone!
customer_reviews.text: an excellent bluetooth earbuds espcially at the discounted price. it sounds better than my son's powerbeats2. It takes a bit of time to find the right fit but it is quite comfortable while working out. Some reviewers compared the sound quality of the X2 to wired hearphones, but these people should have an understanding of the bluetooth technology before making useless comments. You get a X2 or anyother bluetooth headphone for the convenience - when I need an audiophile heaphone, I grap my Hifiman set. As a bluetooth headphone, X2 is one of the best without any question!
customer_reviews.author: ccc
